title: Self-Supervised Representation Learning for Speech Processing in Low-Resource Scenarios (2022 and Earlier
This list provides a mix of foundational works, recent advancements, and applications of SSL in speech processing for low-resource scenarios
**"Representation Learning: A Review and New Perspectives"** by Yoshua Bengio et al
- A comprehensive overview of representation learning, including self-supervised methods
**"Autoregressive Predictive Coding: An Information-Theoretic Framework for Unsupervised Learning"** by Aaron van den Oord et al
- Introduces the concept of autoregressive predictive coding, a key principle behind many SSL methods
**"WaveNet: A Generative Model for Raw Audio"** by Aaron van den Oord et al
- Demonstrates the power of autoregressive models for speech generation and representation learning
Contrastive Predictive Coding"** by Aaron van den Oord et al
- Introduces contrastive predictive coding, a powerful SSL framework for learning representations from unlabeled data
**Recent Advancements in SSL for Speech:**
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Recognition"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- A survey of SSL methods for speech recognition, highlighting their advantages in low-resource settings
**"wav2vec 2.0: A Framework for Self-Supervised Learning of Speech Representations"** by Alexei Baevski et al
- Introduces wav2vec 2.0, a powerful SSL model for speech representation learning
Self-Supervised Speech Representation Learning by Masked Prediction of Hidden Units"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Proposes HuBERT, a masked language modeling approach for speech representation learning
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Recognition: A Comprehensive Survey"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- A comprehensive survey of SSL methods for speech recognition, covering various techniques and applications
**"Contrastive Predictive Coding for Speech Recognition"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Explores the application of CPC for speech recognition, demonstrating its effectiveness in low-resource scenarios
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Recognition: A Review"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- A review of SSL methods for speech recognition, focusing on their advantages and challenges
**Applications of SSL in Low-Resource Speech Processing:**
**"Low-Resource Speech Recognition with Self-Supervised Learning"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Demonstrates the effectiveness of SSL for speech recognition in low-resource languages
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Translation"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Explores the use of SSL for improving speech translation in low-resource settings
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Emotion Recognition"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Investigates the application of SSL for speech emotion recognition, particularly in low-resource scenarios
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speaker Verification"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Explores the use of SSL for speaker verification, highlighting its potential for low-resource languages
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Acoustic Modeling in Low-Resource Speech Recognition"** by Wei-Ning Hsu et al
- Focuses on the application of SSL for acoustic modeling in low-resource speech recognition
**"SpeechBrain: A PyTorch-based Speech Toolkit"** by Mirco Ravanelli et al
- An open-source toolkit for speech processing, including implementations of various SSL methods
**"ESPnet: End-to-End Speech Processing Toolkit"** by Shinji Watanabe et al
- Another open-source toolkit for speech processing, offering support for SSL methods
**"The Speech Recognition Archive"** by the University of Edinburgh - A comprehensive resource for speech recognition research, including datasets and papers
**"The International Speech Communication Association (ISCA)"** - A professional organization for speech communication research, offering resources and conferences
**"The Journal of the Acoustical Society of America (JASA)"** - A leading journal for acoustics research, including publications on speech processing and SSL

This list provides a starting point for exploring the exciting field of self-supervised representation learning for speech processing in low-resource scenarios. Remember to consult the latest research papers and resources for the most up-to-date information
